result.execSummary:
The defendant Timonte Lashion Karroll-Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate A Vehicle Without Owner's Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments including the DNA surcharges.  To be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court sets restitution at zero.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 3 years.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts 10 and 11.  Credit for 217 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time work or school or combination of both.

No contact with codefendants for entire sentence.
Not to reside or be present where firearms are present in any vehicle.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #11
Associated with Charge #10
Associated with Charge #7

Defendant Timonte Lashion Karroll-Robinson in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Defendant Timonte Lashion Karroll-Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.   State advises of victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant.  


AS TO COUNT 7: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS, concurrent to counts 10 and 11, credit for 217 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 10: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS 6 MONTS, concurrent to counts 7 and 11, credit for 217 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 11: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 8 YEARS, concurrent to counts 7 and 10, credit for 217 time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 5 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No contact with co-defendants for entire sentence.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Not to reside or be present where firearms are present in any vehicle.

- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER SERVING 3 YEARS.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, 
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Letter of support for defendant.

Defendant Timonte Lashion Karroll-Robinson in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Defendant Timonte Lashion Karroll-Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 7, 10 AND 11.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 8, 9 AND 12 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Court orders defendent REMANDED into custody pending sentencing.

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendants Motion for Bail Modification from Defendant (Timonte Karrill-Robinson - # 2022000547 Milwaukee County Jail  949 N 9th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233)

Defendant Timonte Lashion Karroll-Robinson in court with Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang; both appear by video.  Defendant Timonte Lashion Karroll-Robinson in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective S. Schmitz. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04 and remains calendared for May 13, 2022 at 10am for status.

Defendant Timonte Lashion Karroll-Robinson in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Timonte Lashion Karroll-Robinson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 12.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.
